meanings.definition: Actions taken to oppose or thwart conspiracies.
meanings.sent1: The group organized various counterconspiracies to protect their community.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to uncovering and stopping counterconspiracies.
meanings.sent3: The detective's cat even seemed involved in the counterconspiracies, always watching suspiciously.
meanings.sent4: In the world of espionage, counterconspiracies are like chess moves in a high-stakes game.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of counterconspiracies battling in the shadows stayed with him long after the case was closed.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a plan to oppose or thwart a conspiracy.
meanings.sent1: Their swift response to the threat showed the importance of quick counterconspiracies.
meanings.sent2: After hours of deliberation, they finally devised a detailed counterconspiracies strategy.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of tag turned into a playful session of counterconspiracies to outsmart each other.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of counterconspiracies, trying to anticipate the next move.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted a thrilling race against time as the heroes planned their daring counterconspiracies.
